word_by_word: **āchārya-varyaṃ**–the best of preceptors; **gaura-dhāma-niṣṭhaṃ**–one who has firm faith in the abode of Śrī Gaura; **śrī-bhakti-rakṣaka-śrīdhara-deva**–Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣaka Śrīdhara Deva Goswāmī’s; **preṣṭham**–dear one; **govindānuraktaṃ**–one who has *anurāga*, intense loving attachment, for Śrīla Bhakti Sundar Govinda Deva Goswāmī’s or Lord Śrī Govinda; **namāmi nityaṃ śrī-madhusūdanaṃ śrī-bhakti-rañjanam**–I eternally bow down to Śrī Bhakti Rañjan Madhusūdana Mahārāj.
translation: With firm faith in Śrī Gaura Dhāma (the abode of Śrī Gaura) he is very dear to Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣaka Śrīdhara Deva Goswāmī Mahārāj, and is the best of preceptors. He is full of intense loving attachment to the service of Govinda (Lord Śrī Govinda and Śrīla Bhakti Sundar Govinda Deva Goswāmī Mahārāj … Govinda, Govinda!). I eternally and repeatedly bow down to Śrīla Bhakti Rañjan Madhusūdana Mahārāj.
